definition: to attempt all tasks at once/to manage every detail regardless of its importance
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
handle
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
careless/any-old-how, regardless of the specific task
pinyin: mei2 mao5 hu2 zi5 yi1 ba3 zhua1

definition: lit. hair and beard all in one stroke/fig. to handle different things by the same method/one method to solve all problems/one size fits all
pinyin: tou2 fa5 hu2 zi5 yi1 ba3 zhua1

sentences.english: Then the fire alarm went off. I just grabbed my clothes and ran out.
sentences.chinese: 當時火險警報器響了，我一把抓起衣服就往外跑。

sentences.english: I love peonies, for its central riches and honor, negligently held on king of flowers.
sentences.chinese: 我愛洛陽花，中州富貴一把抓，花王地位坐地拿。

sentences.english: I can't do everything all at once —you'll have to be patient.
sentences.chinese: 我不能萬事一把抓呀，你可急不得。

sentences.english: The robber snatched them, put them into his pocket, and turned to leave.
sentences.chinese: 搶劫犯一把抓過錢，放入口袋，然後轉身就走。

sentences.english: That boy grasped foods and ate them likes wolf.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩子一把抓過食物，狼吞虎嚥般地吃了下去。

sentences.english: Mine I had snatched from my knees and held over my head, by a sort of instinct.
sentences.chinese: 思嘉從擱板上一把抓起她的寬邊草帽隨手扣在頭上。

sentences.english: The boy wolfed down the food the moment he grabbed it.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩子一把抓過食品，狼吞虎嚥般地吃了下去。

sentences.english: The knapsack lay at the edge of the well, and Jesse snatched it up.
sentences.chinese: 揹包被扔在井邊，傑希把它一把抓過來。

sentences.english: He grabbed the wheelchair and pushed her along.
sentences.chinese: 他一把抓過輪椅，推着她飛跑起來。

sentences.english: The boy grashed the food and edacious ate it .
sentences.chinese: 那男孩子一把抓過食物，狼吞虎嚥般地吃了下去。

sentences.english: He sprang to his feet, grabbing his keys off the coffee table…
sentences.chinese: 他一躍而起，從茶几上一把抓起自己的鑰匙。

sentences.english: Then the fire alarm ____ ___. I just grabbed my clothes and ran out.
sentences.chinese: 當時火險警報器響了，我一把抓起衣服就往外跑。

sentences.english: Jon filled his fist with a pillow and let fly, but the bird took to the air.
sentences.chinese: 瓊恩一把抓起枕頭扔過去，但烏鴉又飛了。

sentences.english: That boy grasped the food quickly and ate it devour ravenously.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩子一把抓過食物，狼吞虎嚥般地吃了下去。

sentences.english: Scarlett caught up her wide straw bonnet from the console table and jammed it on her head.
sentences.chinese: 思嘉從擱板上一把抓起她的寬邊草帽隨手扣在頭上。

sentences.english: The boy wolfed down the food the moment he grabbed it.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩子一把抓過食物，狼吞虎嚥般地吃了下去。

definition: with a lightning move of the hand
to grasp firmly
to grab
to pick up (from the ground with one's hands)
alternate writing of 跩[zhuai3]
to drag/to haul
to pull/to tug at (sth)
to throw/to fling
to allow no explanation
to cast or put aside/to forget for a while
to lift/to carry in one's hand/Taiwan pr. [ling1]
to carry
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to adopt an attitude/to strike a posture
to swing one's arms/to wash one's hands of sth
suddenly
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
